intro: Monopera micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered monopera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and clustered, small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are typically pinnately compound, with long, narrow leaflets. Monopera micrantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
